channel.title: ::begin command?

item.title: ::begin command?
item.dc:creator: @bobbie1990 bobbie1990
item.description:
@bobbie1990 wrote:

try this in client.java:

   if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) {	
        if (starter == 0) {
            addItem(995, 150000000);
            addItem(392, 1337);
            sendMessage("You Have Started Your Adventure");
            starter = 1;
            savemoreinfo();
            savechar();
        } else if (starter == 1) {
            sendMessage("Sorry.");
            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
                    + " Is a noob and is trying to get a extra starter!! :p");

        }
    }

Read full topic

item.title: ::begin command?
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Square:

Is the element, “begin” set onto the character file or misc. file?

Yes, “begin” has to have somewhere to save, or else it will just go back to 0 once you log out and back in.

Read full topic

item.title: ::begin command?
item.dc:creator: @client_class client class
item.description:
@client_class wrote:

I deleted my starter command and added a ::begin command. I know I could’ve just replaced starter with begin but I wanted to know how to add things like that so that I could do it in the future. Apparently, it compiles and when I type in in-game it dcs me and then logs me back in with the items that ::begin was supposed to give me. BUT, I can keep typing it after I used it once, and I keep getting the stuff.

Heres my code:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("begin")) {	
            if (begin == 0) {
                addItem(995, 500000);
                addItem(385, 500);
		teleportToX = 3213;
                teleportToY = 3423;
                sendMessage("You begin your adventure in Cleaned V1!");
                begin = 1;
                savemoreinfo();
                savechar();
            } else if (begin == 1) {
                sendMessage("You can only begin once!");
            }
        }

I declared it, made it save etc… but it just doesn’t want to work :S

Any help?

Read full topic
